review_blob: Can purchased at a market in Charlotte NC. Pours a nice golden color with medium head. Lots of fresh hop aroma and flavors, not overpowering on the bitterness (a good thing IMO). Wish I could drink this one regularly
beer_name: NoDa Hop, Drop n Roll IPA

review_blob: This was a bottle received in a trade, may have been old. Poured amber gold with a thin but dense head, Hoppy and malty - too much malt flavor for my taste. It was yesterday that I drank it, and I did not make notes at the time, so no details on the profile. Bottom line, it was not one of my favorites, but YMMV.

Can poured to tulip glass. Got in a trade, bottled July 27 so getting past its prime. Pours golden color. Minimal head or lacing. Nose is light grapefruit and pine. Taste follows aroma. Smooth drinking and not real hoppy, malt is well balanced by the hops. The 8% abv is not evident. Not outstanding or complex, but drinkable and tasty
beer_name: Golden Road Wolf Among Weeds IPA

review_blob: Looks nice, Pours clear orange with a thin head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is earthy and grassy, borderline barnyard. Not a lot of flavor, bitter with a little maltiness on the finish. not a well conceived effort IMHO.  Glad I bought a single, not a six.
I just plain enjoyed this beer.  Poured golden with a white head - good retention.  Notable citrus aroma, hoppy but not bitter.  Balanced, delicious
No aroma to speak of, nothing noteworthy in the taste.  Very drinkable, but not worth craft brew $ IMHO.  I could have had a blue light
Opaque brown with a thick tan head.  Chocolate, coffee, and roasted grains on the nose. Super full bodied, smooth, a truly memorable glass.
22 oz bottle. Ports black with a finger of tan head.  Malty on the nose, not very hoppy for an IPA.  Tasty, but more like a porter.
